title: Tokyo Motor Show, in pictures: our favourite cars from the world's wildest automotive event
text:
The Tokyo Motor Show is traditionally a venue for Japanese car manufacturers to show off their wackiest ideas and least-plausible concept cars. It's also an opportunity for European journalists to encounter real-world models destined for sale only in Japan. As such, it's one of our favourite automotive events in the world, even if half of what we find there is a little bit silly.

Not that the Suzuki Hustler, pictured above, is anything short of sensible. This is a kei-class concept along the lines of the much-loved Jimny, and will have a tiny engine to go with it. This is the antithesis to the jacked-up, hypermasculine approach to "outdoorsy" cars in the West, and we absolutely love it.

Read on for more of the best Tokyo Motor Show concept and production cars.
